segment.target: App-V 5.1 software prerequisites and supported configurations

segment.target: See the following links for the App-V 5.1 software prerequisites and supported configurations.

segment.source: Description

segment.source: App-V 5.1 Prerequisites
segment.target: App-V 5.1 Prerequisites

segment.source: Prerequisite software that you must install before starting the App-V 5.1 installation
segment.target: Prerequisite software that you must install before starting the App-V 5.1 installation

segment.source: App-V 5.1 Supported Configurations
segment.target: App-V 5.1 Supported Configurations

segment.source: Supported operating systems and hardware requirements for the App-V Server, Sequencer, and Client components
segment.target: Supported operating systems and hardware requirements for the App-V Server, Sequencer, and Client components

segment.source: Support for using Configuration Manager with App-V: App-V 5.1 supports System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1.
segment.target: Support for using Configuration Manager with App-V: App-V 5.1 supports System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1.

segment.source: See Planning for App-V Integration with Configuration Manager for information about integrating your App-V environment with Configuration Manager and Configuration Manager.
segment.target: See Planning for App-V Integration with Configuration Manager for information about integrating your App-V environment with Configuration Manager and Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Migrating to App-V 5.1
segment.target: Migrating to App-V 5.1

segment.source: Use the following information to upgrade to App-V 5.1 from earlier versions.
segment.target: Use the following information to upgrade to App-V 5.1 from earlier versions.

segment.source: See Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version for more information.
segment.target: See Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version for more information.

segment.source: Before you start the upgrade
segment.target: Before you start the upgrade

segment.source: Review the following information before you start the upgrade:
segment.target: Review the following information before you start the upgrade:

segment.source: Items to review before upgrading
segment.target: Items to review before upgrading

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Components to upgrade, in any order
segment.target: Components to upgrade, in any order

segment.source: App-V Server
segment.target: App-V Server

segment.source: Sequencer
segment.target: Sequencer

segment.source: App-V Client or App-V Remote Desktop Services (RDS) Client
segment.target: App-V Client or App-V Remote Desktop Services (RDS) Client

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Prior to App-V 5.0 SP2, the Client Management User Interface (UI) was provided with the App-V Client installation.
segment.target: Prior to App-V 5.0 SP2, the Client Management User Interface (UI) was provided with the App-V Client installation.

segment.source: For App-V 5.0 SP2 installations (or later), you can use the Client Management UI by downloading from Application Virtualization 5.0 Client UI Application.
segment.target: For App-V 5.0 SP2 installations (or later), you can use the Client Management UI by downloading from Application Virtualization 5.0 Client UI Application.

segment.source: Upgrading from App-V 4.x
segment.target: Upgrading from App-V 4.x

segment.source: You must first upgrade to App-V 5.0.
segment.target: You must first upgrade to App-V 5.0.

segment.source: You cannot upgrade directly from App-V 4.x to App-V 5.1.
segment.target: You cannot upgrade directly from App-V 4.x to App-V 5.1.

segment.source: For more information, see:
segment.target: For more information, see:

segment.source: “Differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.0” in About App-V 5.0
segment.target: “Differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.0” in About App-V 5.0

segment.source: Planning for Migrating from a Previous Version of App-V
segment.target: Planning for Migrating from a Previous Version of App-V

segment.source: Upgrading from App-V 5.0 or later
segment.target: Upgrading from App-V 5.0 or later

segment.source: You can upgrade to App-V 5.1 directly from any of the following versions:
segment.target: You can upgrade to App-V 5.1 directly from any of the following versions:

segment.source: App-V 5.0
segment.target: App-V 5.0

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP1
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP1

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP2
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP2

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: To upgrade to App-V 5.1, follow the steps in the remaining sections of this topic.
segment.target: To upgrade to App-V 5.1, follow the steps in the remaining sections of this topic.

segment.source: Packages and connection groups will continue to work with App-V 5.1 as they currently do.
segment.target: Packages and connection groups will continue to work with App-V 5.1 as they currently do.

segment.source: Steps to upgrade the App-V infrastructure
segment.target: Steps to upgrade the App-V infrastructure

segment.source: Complete the following steps to upgrade each component of the App-V infrastructure to App-V 5.1.
segment.target: Complete the following steps to upgrade each component of the App-V infrastructure to App-V 5.1.

segment.source: The following order is only a suggestion; you may upgrade components in any order.
segment.target: The following order is only a suggestion; you may upgrade components in any order.

segment.source: Step
segment.target: Step

segment.source: For more information
segment.target: For more information

segment.source: Step 1: Upgrade the App-V Server.
segment.target: Step 1: Upgrade the App-V Server.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are not using the App-V Server, skip this step and go to the next step.
segment.target: If you are not using the App-V Server, skip this step and go to the next step.

segment.source: Follow these steps:
segment.target: Follow these steps:

segment.source: Do one of the following, depending on the method you are using to upgrade the Management database and/or Reporting database:
segment.target: Do one of the following, depending on the method you are using to upgrade the Management database and/or Reporting database:

segment.source: Database upgrade method
segment.target: Database upgrade method

segment.source: Step
segment.target: Step

segment.source: Windows Installer
segment.target: Windows Installer

segment.source: Skip this step and go to step 2, “If you are upgrading the App-V Server...”
segment.target: Skip this step and go to step 2, “If you are upgrading the App-V Server...”

segment.source: SQL scripts
segment.target: SQL scripts

segment.source: Follow the steps in How to Deploy the App-V Databases by Using SQL Scripts.
segment.target: Follow the steps in How to Deploy the App-V Databases by Using SQL Scripts.

segment.source: If you are upgrading the App-V Server from App-V 5.0 SP1 Hotfix Package 3 or later, complete the steps in section Check registry keys after installing the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server.
segment.target: If you are upgrading the App-V Server from App-V 5.0 SP1 Hotfix Package 3 or later, complete the steps in section Check registry keys after installing the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server.

segment.source: Follow the steps in How to Deploy the App-V 5.1 Server
segment.target: Follow the steps in How to Deploy the App-V 5.1 Server

segment.source: Step 2: Upgrade the App-V Sequencer.
segment.target: Step 2: Upgrade the App-V Sequencer.

segment.source: See How to Install the Sequencer.
segment.target: See How to Install the Sequencer.

segment.source: Step 3: Upgrade the App-V Client or App-V RDS Client.
segment.target: Step 3: Upgrade the App-V Client or App-V RDS Client.

segment.source: See How to Deploy the App-V Client.
segment.target: See How to Deploy the App-V Client.

segment.source: Converting packages created using a prior version of App-V
segment.target: Converting packages created using a prior version of App-V

segment.source: Use the package converter utility to upgrade virtual application packages created using versions of App-V prior to App-V 5.0.
segment.target: Use the package converter utility to upgrade virtual application packages created using versions of App-V prior to App-V 5.0.

segment.source: The package converter uses PowerShell to convert packages and can help automate the process if you have many packages that require conversion.
segment.target: The package converter uses PowerShell to convert packages and can help automate the process if you have many packages that require conversion.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: App-V 5.1 packages are exactly the same as App-V 5.0 packages.
segment.target: App-V 5.1 packages are exactly the same as App-V 5.0 packages.

segment.source: There has been no change in the package format between the versions and so there is no need to convert App-V 5.0 packages to App-V 5.1 packages.
segment.target: There has been no change in the package format between the versions and so there is no need to convert App-V 5.0 packages to App-V 5.1 packages.

segment.source: What’s New in App-V 5.1
segment.target: What’s New in App-V 5.1

segment.source: These sections are for users who are already familiar with App-V and want to know what has changed in App-V 5.1.
segment.target: These sections are for users who are already familiar with App-V and want to know what has changed in App-V 5.1.

segment.source: If you are not already familiar with App-V, you should start by reading Planning for App-V 5.1.
segment.target: If you are not already familiar with App-V, you should start by reading Planning for App-V 5.1.

segment.source: App-V support for Windows 10
segment.target: App-V support for Windows 10

segment.source: The following table lists the Windows 10 support for App-V.
segment.target: The following table lists the Windows 10 support for App-V.

segment.source: Windows 10 is not supported in versions of App-V prior to App-V 5.1.
segment.target: Windows 10 is not supported in versions of App-V prior to App-V 5.1.

segment.target: Component

segment.target: App-V 5.1

segment.target: App-V 5.0

segment.source: App-V Client
segment.target: App-V Client

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: App-V RDS Client
segment.target: App-V RDS Client

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: App-V Sequencer
segment.target: App-V Sequencer

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: App-V Management Console Changes
segment.target: App-V Management Console Changes

segment.source: This section compares the App-V Management Console’s current and previous functionality.
segment.target: This section compares the App-V Management Console’s current and previous functionality.

segment.source: Silverlight is no longer required
segment.target: Silverlight is no longer required

segment.source: The Management Console UI no longer requires Silverlight.
segment.target: The Management Console UI no longer requires Silverlight.

segment.source: The 5.1 Management Console is built on HTML5 and Javascript.
segment.target: The 5.1 Management Console is built on HTML5 and Javascript.

segment.source: Notifications and messages are displayed individually in a dialog box
segment.target: Notifications and messages are displayed individually in a dialog box

segment.source: New in App-V 5.1
segment.target: New in App-V 5.1

segment.source: Prior to App-V 5.1
segment.target: Prior to App-V 5.1

segment.source: Number of messages indicator:
segment.target: Number of messages indicator:

segment.source: On the title bar of the App-V Management Console, a number is now displayed next to a flag icon to indicate the number of messages that are waiting to be read.
segment.target: On the title bar of the App-V Management Console, a number is now displayed next to a flag icon to indicate the number of messages that are waiting to be read.

segment.source: You could see only one message or error at a time, and you were unable to determine how many messages there were.
segment.target: You could see only one message or error at a time, and you were unable to determine how many messages there were.

segment.source: Message appearance:
segment.target: Message appearance:

segment.source: Messages that require user input appear in a separate dialog box that displays on top of the current page that you were viewing, and require a response before you can dismiss them.
segment.target: Messages that require user input appear in a separate dialog box that displays on top of the current page that you were viewing, and require a response before you can dismiss them.

segment.source: Messages and errors appear in a list, with one beneath the other.
segment.target: Messages and errors appear in a list, with one beneath the other.

segment.source: You could see only one message or error at a time.
segment.target: You could see only one message or error at a time.

segment.source: Dismissing messages:
segment.target: Dismissing messages:

segment.source: Use the Dismiss All link to dismiss all messages and errors at one time, or dismiss them one at a time.
segment.target: Use the Dismiss All link to dismiss all messages and errors at one time, or dismiss them one at a time.

segment.source: You could dismiss messages and errors only one at a time.
segment.target: You could dismiss messages and errors only one at a time.

segment.source: Console pages are now separate URLs
segment.target: Console pages are now separate URLs

segment.source: New in App-V 5.1
segment.target: New in App-V 5.1

segment.source: Prior to App-V 5.1
segment.target: Prior to App-V 5.1

segment.source: Each page in the console has a different URL, which enables you to bookmark specific pages for quick access in the future.
segment.target: Each page in the console has a different URL, which enables you to bookmark specific pages for quick access in the future.

segment.source: The number that appears in some URLs indicates the specific package.
segment.target: The number that appears in some URLs indicates the specific package.

segment.source: These numbers are unique.
segment.target: These numbers are unique.

segment.source: All console pages are accessed through the same URL.
segment.target: All console pages are accessed through the same URL.

segment.source: New, separate CONNECTION GROUPS page and menu option
segment.target: New, separate CONNECTION GROUPS page and menu option

segment.source: New in App-V 5.1
segment.target: New in App-V 5.1

segment.source: Prior to App-V 5.1
segment.target: Prior to App-V 5.1

segment.source: The CONNECTION GROUPS page is now part of the main menu, at the same level as the PACKAGES page.
segment.target: The CONNECTION GROUPS page is now part of the main menu, at the same level as the PACKAGES page.

segment.source: To open the CONNECTION GROUPS page, you navigate through the PACKAGES page.
segment.target: To open the CONNECTION GROUPS page, you navigate through the PACKAGES page.

segment.source: Menu options for packages have changed
segment.target: Menu options for packages have changed

segment.source: New in App-V 5.1
segment.target: New in App-V 5.1

segment.source: Prior to App-V 5.1
segment.target: Prior to App-V 5.1

segment.source: The following options are now buttons that appear at the bottom of the PACKAGES page:
segment.target: The following options are now buttons that appear at the bottom of the PACKAGES page:

segment.source: Add or Upgrade
segment.target: Add or Upgrade

segment.source: Publish
segment.target: Publish

segment.source: Unpublish
segment.target: Unpublish

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: The following options will still appear when you right-click a package to open the drop-down context menu:
segment.target: The following options will still appear when you right-click a package to open the drop-down context menu:

segment.source: Publish
segment.target: Publish

segment.source: Unpublish
segment.target: Unpublish

segment.source: Edit AD Access
segment.target: Edit AD Access

segment.source: Edit Deployment Config
segment.target: Edit Deployment Config

segment.source: Transfer deployment configuration from…
segment.target: Transfer deployment configuration from…

segment.source: Transfer access and configuration from…
segment.target: Transfer access and configuration from…

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: When you click Delete to remove a package, a dialog box opens and asks you to confirm that you want to delete the package.
segment.target: When you click Delete to remove a package, a dialog box opens and asks you to confirm that you want to delete the package.

segment.source: The Add or Upgrade option was a button at the top right of the PACKAGES page.
segment.target: The Add or Upgrade option was a button at the top right of the PACKAGES page.

segment.source: The Publish, Unpublish, and Delete options were available only if you right-clicked a package name in the packages list.
segment.target: The Publish, Unpublish, and Delete options were available only if you right-clicked a package name in the packages list.

segment.source: The following package operations are now buttons on the package details page for each package:
segment.target: The following package operations are now buttons on the package details page for each package:

segment.source: Transfer (drop-down menu with the following options):
segment.target: Transfer (drop-down menu with the following options):

segment.source: Transfer deployment configuration from…
segment.target: Transfer deployment configuration from…

segment.source: Transfer access and configuration from…
segment.target: Transfer access and configuration from…

segment.source: Edit (connection groups and AD Access)
segment.target: Edit (connection groups and AD Access)

segment.source: Unpublish
segment.target: Unpublish

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: Edit Default Configuration
segment.target: Edit Default Configuration

segment.source: These package options were available only if you right-clicked a package name in the packages list.
segment.target: These package options were available only if you right-clicked a package name in the packages list.

segment.source: Icons in left pane have new colors and text
segment.target: Icons in left pane have new colors and text

segment.source: The colors of the icons in the left pane have been changed, and text added, to make the icons consistent with other Microsoft products.
segment.target: The colors of the icons in the left pane have been changed, and text added, to make the icons consistent with other Microsoft products.

segment.source: Overview page has been removed
segment.target: Overview page has been removed

segment.source: In the left pane of the Management Console, the OVERVIEW menu option and its associated OVERVIEW page have been removed.
segment.target: In the left pane of the Management Console, the OVERVIEW menu option and its associated OVERVIEW page have been removed.

segment.source: Sequencer Improvements
segment.target: Sequencer Improvements

segment.source: The following improvements have been made to the package editor in the App-V 5.1 Sequencer.
segment.target: The following improvements have been made to the package editor in the App-V 5.1 Sequencer.

segment.source: Import and export the manifest file
segment.target: Import and export the manifest file

segment.source: You can import and export the AppxManifest.xml file.
segment.target: You can import and export the AppxManifest.xml file.

segment.source: To export the manifest file, select the Advanced tab and in the Manifest File box, click Export....
segment.target: To export the manifest file, select the Advanced tab and in the Manifest File box, click Export....

segment.source: You can make changes to the manifest file, such as removing shell extensions or editing file type associations.
segment.target: You can make changes to the manifest file, such as removing shell extensions or editing file type associations.

segment.source: After you make your changes, click Import... and select the file you edited.
segment.target: After you make your changes, click Import... and select the file you edited.

segment.source: After you successfully import it back in, the manifest file is immediately updated within the package editor.
segment.target: After you successfully import it back in, the manifest file is immediately updated within the package editor.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: When you import the file, your changes are validated against the XML schema.
segment.target: When you import the file, your changes are validated against the XML schema.

segment.source: If the file is not valid, you will receive an error.
segment.target: If the file is not valid, you will receive an error.

segment.source: Be aware that it is possible to import a file that is validated against the XML schema, but that might still fail to run for other reasons.
segment.target: Be aware that it is possible to import a file that is validated against the XML schema, but that might still fail to run for other reasons.

segment.source: Addition of Windows 10 to operating systems list
segment.target: Addition of Windows 10 to operating systems list

segment.source: In the Deployment tab, Windows 10 32-bit and Windows 10-64 bit have been added to the list of operating systems for which you can sequence a package.
segment.target: In the Deployment tab, Windows 10 32-bit and Windows 10-64 bit have been added to the list of operating systems for which you can sequence a package.

segment.source: If you select Any Operating System, Windows 10 is automatically included among the operating systems that the sequenced package will support.
segment.target: If you select Any Operating System, Windows 10 is automatically included among the operating systems that the sequenced package will support.

segment.source: Current path displays at bottom of virtual registry editor
segment.target: Current path displays at bottom of virtual registry editor

segment.source: In the Virtual Registry tab, the path now displays at the bottom of the virtual registry editor, which enables you to determine the currently selected key.
segment.target: In the Virtual Registry tab, the path now displays at the bottom of the virtual registry editor, which enables you to determine the currently selected key.

segment.source: Previously, you had to scroll through the registry tree to find the currently selected key.
segment.target: Previously, you had to scroll through the registry tree to find the currently selected key.

segment.source: Combined “find and replace” dialog box and shortcut keys added in virtual registry editor
segment.target: Combined “find and replace” dialog box and shortcut keys added in virtual registry editor

segment.source: In the virtual registry editor, shortcut keys have been added for the Find option (Ctrl+F), and a dialog box that combines the “find” and “replace” tasks has been added to enable you to find and replace values and data.
segment.target: In the virtual registry editor, shortcut keys have been added for the Find option (Ctrl+F), and a dialog box that combines the “find” and “replace” tasks has been added to enable you to find and replace values and data.

segment.source: To access this combined dialog box, select a key and do one of the following:
segment.target: To access this combined dialog box, select a key and do one of the following:

segment.source: Press Ctrl+H
segment.target: Press Ctrl+H

segment.source: Right-click a key and select Replace.
segment.target: Right-click a key and select Replace.

segment.source: Select ViewVirtual RegistryReplace.
segment.target: Select ViewVirtual RegistryReplace.

segment.source: Previously, the “Replace” dialog box did not exist, and you had to make changes manually.
segment.target: Previously, the “Replace” dialog box did not exist, and you had to make changes manually.

segment.source: Rename registry keys and package files successfully
segment.target: Rename registry keys and package files successfully

segment.source: You can rename virtual registry keys and files without experiencing Sequencer issues.
segment.target: You can rename virtual registry keys and files without experiencing Sequencer issues.

segment.source: Previously, the Sequencer stopped working if you tried to rename a key.
segment.target: Previously, the Sequencer stopped working if you tried to rename a key.

segment.source: Import and export virtual registry keys
segment.target: Import and export virtual registry keys

segment.source: You can import and export virtual registry keys.
segment.target: You can import and export virtual registry keys.

segment.source: To import a key, right-click the node under which to import the key, navigate to the key you want to import, and then click Import.
segment.target: To import a key, right-click the node under which to import the key, navigate to the key you want to import, and then click Import.

segment.source: To export a key, right-click the key and select Export.
segment.target: To export a key, right-click the key and select Export.

segment.source: Import a directory into the virtual file system
segment.target: Import a directory into the virtual file system

segment.source: You can import a directory into the VFS.
segment.target: You can import a directory into the VFS.

segment.source: To import a directory, click the Package Files tab, and then click ViewVirtual File SystemImport Directory.
segment.target: To import a directory, click the Package Files tab, and then click ViewVirtual File SystemImport Directory.

segment.source: If you try to import a directory that contains files that are already in the VFS, the import fails, and an explanatory message is displayed.
segment.target: If you try to import a directory that contains files that are already in the VFS, the import fails, and an explanatory message is displayed.

segment.source: Prior to App-V 5.1, you could not import directories.
segment.target: Prior to App-V 5.1, you could not import directories.

segment.source: Import or export a VFS file without having to delete and then add it back to the package
segment.target: Import or export a VFS file without having to delete and then add it back to the package

segment.source: You can import files to or export files from the VFS without having to delete the file and then add it back to the package.
segment.target: You can import files to or export files from the VFS without having to delete the file and then add it back to the package.

segment.source: For example, you might use this feature to export a change log to a local drive, edit the file using an external editor, and then re-import the file into the VFS.
segment.target: For example, you might use this feature to export a change log to a local drive, edit the file using an external editor, and then re-import the file into the VFS.

segment.source: To export a file, select the Package Files tab, right-click the file in the VFS, click Export, and choose an export location from which you can make your edits.
segment.target: To export a file, select the Package Files tab, right-click the file in the VFS, click Export, and choose an export location from which you can make your edits.

segment.source: To import a file, select the Package Files tab and right-click the file that you had exported.
segment.target: To import a file, select the Package Files tab and right-click the file that you had exported.

segment.source: Browse to the file that you edited, and then click Import.
segment.target: Browse to the file that you edited, and then click Import.

segment.source: The imported file will overwrite the existing file.
segment.target: The imported file will overwrite the existing file.

segment.source: After you import a file, you must save the package by clicking FileSave.
segment.target: After you import a file, you must save the package by clicking FileSave.

segment.source: Menu for adding a package file has moved
segment.target: Menu for adding a package file has moved

segment.source: The menu option for adding a package file has been moved.
segment.target: The menu option for adding a package file has been moved.

segment.source: To find the Add option, select the Package Files tab, then click ViewVirtual File SystemAdd File.
segment.target: To find the Add option, select the Package Files tab, then click ViewVirtual File SystemAdd File.

segment.source: Previously, you right-clicked a folder under the VFS node, and chose Add File.
segment.target: Previously, you right-clicked a folder under the VFS node, and chose Add File.

segment.source: Virtual registry node expands MACHINE and USER hives by default
segment.target: Virtual registry node expands MACHINE and USER hives by default

segment.source: When you open the virtual registry, the MACHINE and USER hives are shown below the top-level REGISTRY node.
segment.target: When you open the virtual registry, the MACHINE and USER hives are shown below the top-level REGISTRY node.

segment.source: Previously, you had to expand the REGISTRY node to show the hives beneath.
segment.target: Previously, you had to expand the REGISTRY node to show the hives beneath.

segment.source: Enable or disable Browser Helper Objects
segment.target: Enable or disable Browser Helper Objects

segment.source: You can enable or disable Browser Helper Objects by selecting a new check box, Enable Browser Helper Objects, on the Advanced tab of the Sequencer user interface.
segment.target: You can enable or disable Browser Helper Objects by selecting a new check box, Enable Browser Helper Objects, on the Advanced tab of the Sequencer user interface.

segment.source: If Browser Helper Objects:
segment.target: If Browser Helper Objects:

segment.source: Exist in the package and are enabled, the check box is selected by default.
segment.target: Exist in the package and are enabled, the check box is selected by default.

segment.source: Exist in the package and are disabled, the check box is clear by default.
segment.target: Exist in the package and are disabled, the check box is clear by default.

segment.source: Exist in the package, with one or more enabled and one or more disabled, the check box is set to indeterminate by default.
segment.target: Exist in the package, with one or more enabled and one or more disabled, the check box is set to indeterminate by default.

segment.source: Do not exist in the package, the check box is disabled.
segment.target: Do not exist in the package, the check box is disabled.

segment.source: Improvements to Package Converter
segment.target: Improvements to Package Converter

segment.source: You can now use the package converter to convert App-V 4.6 packages that contain scripts, and registry information and scripts from source .osd files are now included in package converter output.
segment.target: You can now use the package converter to convert App-V 4.6 packages that contain scripts, and registry information and scripts from source .osd files are now included in package converter output.

segment.source: For more information including examples, see Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version.
segment.target: For more information including examples, see Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version.

segment.source: Support for multiple scripts on a single event trigger
segment.target: Support for multiple scripts on a single event trigger

segment.source: App-V 5.1 supports the use of multiple scripts on a single event trigger for App-V packages, including packages that you are converting from App-V 4.6 to App-V 5.0 or later.
segment.target: App-V 5.1 supports the use of multiple scripts on a single event trigger for App-V packages, including packages that you are converting from App-V 4.6 to App-V 5.0 or later.

segment.source: To enable the use of multiple scripts, App-V 5.1 uses a script launcher application, named ScriptRunner.exe, which is installed as part of the App-V client installation.
segment.target: To enable the use of multiple scripts, App-V 5.1 uses a script launcher application, named ScriptRunner.exe, which is installed as part of the App-V client installation.

segment.source: For more information, including a list of event triggers and the context under which scripts can be run, see the Scripts section in About App-V 5.1 Dynamic Configuration.
segment.target: For more information, including a list of event triggers and the context under which scripts can be run, see the Scripts section in About App-V 5.1 Dynamic Configuration.

segment.source: Hardcoded path to installation folder is redirected to virtual file system root
segment.target: Hardcoded path to installation folder is redirected to virtual file system root

segment.source: When you convert packages from App-V 4.6 to 5.1, the App-V 5.1 package can access the hardcoded drive that you were required to use when you created 4.6 packages.
segment.target: When you convert packages from App-V 4.6 to 5.1, the App-V 5.1 package can access the hardcoded drive that you were required to use when you created 4.6 packages.

segment.source: The drive letter will be the drive you selected as the installation drive on the 4.6 sequencing machine.
segment.target: The drive letter will be the drive you selected as the installation drive on the 4.6 sequencing machine.

segment.source: (The default drive letter is Q:.)
segment.target: (The default drive letter is Q:.)

segment.source: Previously, the 4.6 root folder was not recognized and could not be accessed by App-V 5.0 packages.
segment.target: Previously, the 4.6 root folder was not recognized and could not be accessed by App-V 5.0 packages.

segment.source: App-V 5.1 packages can access hardcoded files by their full path or can programmatically enumerate files under the App-V 4.6 installation root.
segment.target: App-V 5.1 packages can access hardcoded files by their full path or can programmatically enumerate files under the App-V 4.6 installation root.

segment.source: Technical Details: The App-V 5.1 package converter will save the App-V 4.6 installation root folder and short folder names in the FilesystemMetadata.xml file in the Filesystem element.
segment.target: Technical Details: The App-V 5.1 package converter will save the App-V 4.6 installation root folder and short folder names in the FilesystemMetadata.xml file in the Filesystem element.

segment.source: When the App-V 5.1 client creates the virtual process, it will map requests from the App-V 4.6 installation root to the virtual file system root.
segment.target: When the App-V 5.1 client creates the virtual process, it will map requests from the App-V 4.6 installation root to the virtual file system root.

segment.source: How to Get MDOP Technologies
segment.target: How to Get MDOP Technologies

segment.source: App-V is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).
segment.target: App-V is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).

segment.source: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.
segment.target: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP.
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.

segment.target: Related topics
